changelog.release_notes:
In the interest of reducing the battery usage, when the watchface is "broken mode" it will now automatically revert back to "fixed" after 2 minutes.
This is particularly helpful in cases where the "flick of the wrist" that triggered the switch to "broken mode" was unintentional (i.e. you are not even looking at the watch but it is busy redrawing the screen frequently and thus using the battery unnecessarily).
Minor bug fix

Initial release.
Analog face with accelerometer action!
Bluetooth connection indicator
Battery indicator
Charging indicator
Day of month display

data.description:
Broken! is a great watchface to show off your Pebble. Flick your wrist and the hands come loose and will spin in whatever direction you tilt your wrist. A random set of the hour markers come loose and will roll around your Pebble's face. Flick again and your watch returns to normal.
Features date, Bluetooth connection, battery and charging indicators.
Please heart if you like it!

data.author: Dexterity

changelog.release_notes:
7.4 Release Notes
1. Implement XML ontimeout for watch freezing problems.
2. Implement XML onerror for logs, and to handle aborts properly.
3. Implement calls to sync error handler in all sync and message handlers, to reprocess messages and flag any freezing conditions.
4. New restart message to handle old pebble and pebble time users. Will now go to "Reload/Restart" to prompt user to reload watchface first to fix condition, and then restart watch/phone.
4. Display nothing instead of logo when receive bad icon data. For xDrip users.
5. Display nothing instead of logo when receive NON_COMPUTABLE icon data. For xDrip users.
6. New Easter eggs.

MAINTENANCE RELEASE ONLY

1. Fix for people getting CAL in raw field all the time, even after calibrating; mainly for xDrip users

*Blank timeago space has been permanently removed, which will forever cease and desist.
*Insert happy, marshmallow fluffy, dextrose like, cloud icons for timeago. 
*Take away dexcom icon for timeago, which will forever cease and desist.
*Evolve state transitions to work better together, with ambidextrous efficiency.
*Memory fixes and optimizations, which have been dexterously implemented.
*Easter eggs, new 100 / 5.5 animations. No ceasing and desisting necessary.

Release 7.1

1. New compression warning - will show COMPRESSION? when pebble detects possible compression low
2. Raw values will show between 30-500 (or MMOL equivalent), and show LO and HI outside of those values; raw values outside of those ranges will show ??
3. Timeago change so now will show last actual time received by pebble; timeago will be blank when loading or coming back from any "pebble outage" (no bluetooth,check phone, etc), and then will show timeago from last received actual reading on pebble so user can know actual last reading received
4. Time fixes so now time works across time zone changes, dexcom time changes, dexcom time drift issues, daylight savings time changes, future data point problems, xdrip time issues, and any kind of phone time issues (auto update / non auto update, etc).
5. Pebble crash fixes
6. Animation crash fixes
7. Memory problem fixes
8. Image size fixes
9. Random buzzing fixes
10. New easter egg messages

R7.0 Release Notes

1. Low vibration alert now goes down to 60.
2. If raw enabled on pebble endpoint, show calculated raw on face.
3. If raw enabled on pebble endpoint, show noise levels on face. Noise levels displayed - Cln Clean, Lgt Light, Med Medium, Hvy Heavy.
4. If raw enabled on pebble endpoint, in special values (e.g. ???) the last three calculated values will be displayed in the BG field if they exist.
5. If raw enabled on pebble endpoint, watch can vibrate on last calculated raw in special values (e.g. ???). User can set the setting in the configuration file to "Yes" or "No".
6. User can put "IOB" in T1DName in config, and if IOB is enabled on website the IOB value will show up instead of T1DName.
7. Move rig / uploader battery percentage to top half and label as "Rig".
8. Show watch battery percentage on face, and switch percentage to CHARGING when plugged in. Label as "Wch".
9. Extend RESTRT timeout so that it appears after NO BLUETOOTH timeout, and really only appears when needed.
10. Extend DATA timeout so that it appears after CHECK PHONE timeout, and really only appears when needed.
11. Change RESTRT WCH/PHN message to √APP/RESTRT, to instruct apple users to open their app, and instruct everyone to restart their watch and phone if necessary.
12. Change DATA OFFLINE message to ATTN: NO DATA to warn users that there is a problem getting data but imply we are still trying to get data and will clear the message when we can.
13. Change CHECK CGM message to CHECK RIG to clarify to the user that they need to check the entire rig, not just the CGM.
14. Ability to set custom and multiple animation messages at different BG levels in the code.

1. Extended timeout for DATA OFFLINE condition
2. Extended timeout for RSTRT WCH/PH condition
3. Added vibe for DATA OFFLINE condition
4. Don't wipeout screen for DATA OFFLINE condition
1. Added offline message

1. Fix for watch freezing
2. Fix for ERR codes
3. Fix for HTML timeouts
4. New global variable to turn off all vibrations (HardCode)
5. New slot2 loads have new config files
Holiday Motivation Version

1. Configurable settings for vibrations - high bg, low bg, snooze times, vibration levels, vibration patterns
2. Configurable setting for 12 hour or 24 hour time
3. App crash fixes, having to do with pebble string buffers
4. App crash fixes, having to do with pebble SDK 2.8
5. Change MMOL LO threshold setting so will show LO
6. Change menuicon to cloud to avoid app crash on pebble SDK 2.8

1. New Vibration Patterns - 3 Levels. Shake and Wake for lows. Long and Strong for highs and special values. Buzzy Bee for everything else.
2. RSTRT WCH/PH - Watch will show RSTRT WCH/PH for any offline, stale data, or watch freezing condition that can not be fixed by software, prompting user to first try restarting watch to fix, then restarting phone to clear up condition.
2. NO ENDPOINT Msg - Watch will show NO ENDPOINT when nothing found in endpoint field in SETTINGS file, prompting user to open SETTINGS on pebble app and enter or re-enter pebble endpoint information.
3. Low Battery Alerts - Watch will now vibrate once and highlight percentage when uploader battery gets to 20% or lower. Especially good for people with uploaders on wireless chargers.
4. APP CRASH fixes - Implemented multiple fixes for APP CRASH conditions.
Fix for iPhone refresh

R5.0 Updates
1. Loads faster
2. New vibration pattern
3. Post HI and LO for high and low BG, like receiver
4. Post ERR for any invalid input to watch (check pebble endpoint msg)
5. Less CHECK PHONE and CHECK CGM msgs (timeouts 5 minutes longer)

changelog.release_notes: * Significant fixes for NO BLUETOOTH errors * Significant fixes for RESTART / RELOAD errors * Significant fixes for LOADING errors * New holiday color face - Fourth of July edition * New Easter Egg

RELEASE NOTES

All Watches:
* Set vibrations on or off (set SLEEP FACE).
* Display raw however you want (all raw on or off, or just turn unfiltered raw on or off).
* Display two different kinds of fonts.
* Display battery levels as numbers or intuitive emojis - emojis will go from happy to sad to angry as the power levels drop.
* Express how you are feeling - You can type in a name at the bottom with emojis to express how you are feeling that day; note emojis will always sleep when vibrations are turned off.
* Set animations on or off.
* Fixes for freezing.
* Fixes to enhance bluetooth connections.
* All new Easter Eggs.
PLEASE NOTE all changes in settings take up to 60 seconds to show up on watchface.

7.4 Release Notes
1. Implement XML ontimeout for watch freezing problems.
2. Implement XML onerror for logs, and to handle aborts properly.
3. Implement calls to sync error handler in all sync and message handlers, to reprocess messages and flag any freezing conditions.
4. New restart message to handle old pebble and pebble time users. Will now go to "Reload/Restart" to prompt user to reload watchface first to fix condition, and then restart watch/phone.
4. Display nothing instead of logo when receive bad icon data. For xDrip users.
5. Display nothing instead of logo when receive NON_COMPUTABLE icon data. For xDrip users.
6. New Easter eggs.

MAINTENANCE RELEASE ONLY

1. Fix for people getting CAL in raw field all the time, even after calibrating; mainly for xDrip users

*Blank timeago space has been permanently removed, which will forever cease and desist.
*Insert happy, marshmallow fluffy, dextrose like, cloud icons for timeago. 
*Take away dexcom icon for timeago, which will forever cease and desist.
*Evolve state transitions to work better together, with ambidextrous efficiency.
*Memory fixes and optimizations, which have been dexterously implemented.
*Easter eggs, new 100 / 5.5 animations. No ceasing and desisting necessary.

Release 7.1

1. New compression warning - will show COMPRESSION? when pebble detects possible compression low
2. Raw values will show between 30-500 (or MMOL equivalent), and show LO and HI outside of those values; raw values outside of those ranges will show ??
3. Timeago change so now will show last actual time received by pebble; timeago will be blank when loading or coming back from any "pebble outage" (no bluetooth,check phone, etc), and then will show timeago from last received actual reading on pebble so user can know actual last reading received
4. Time fixes so now time works across time zone changes, dexcom time changes, dexcom time drift issues, daylight savings time changes, future data point problems, xdrip time issues, and any kind of phone time issues (auto update / non auto update, etc).
5. Pebble crash fixes
6. Animation crash fixes
7. Memory problem fixes
8. Image size fixes
9. Random buzzing fixes
10. New easter egg messages

R7.0 Release Notes

1. Low vibration alert now goes down to 60.
2. If raw enabled on pebble endpoint, show calculated raw on face.
3. If raw enabled on pebble endpoint, show noise levels on face. Noise levels displayed - Cln Clean, Lgt Light, Med Medium, Hvy Heavy.
4. If raw enabled on pebble endpoint, in special values (e.g. ???) the last three calculated values will be displayed in the BG field if they exist.
5. If raw enabled on pebble endpoint, watch can vibrate on last calculated raw in special values (e.g. ???). User can set the setting in the configuration file to "Yes" or "No".
6. User can put "IOB" in T1DName in config, and if IOB is enabled on website the IOB value will show up instead of T1DName.
7. Move rig / uploader battery percentage to top half and label as "Rig".
8. Show watch battery percentage on face, and switch percentage to CHARGING when plugged in. Label as "Wch".
9. Extend RESTRT timeout so that it appears after NO BLUETOOTH timeout, and really only appears when needed.
10. Extend DATA timeout so that it appears after CHECK PHONE timeout, and really only appears when needed.
11. Change RESTRT WCH/PHN message to √APP/RESTRT, to instruct apple users to open their app, and instruct everyone to restart their watch and phone if necessary.
12. Change DATA OFFLINE message to ATTN: NO DATA to warn users that there is a problem getting data but imply we are still trying to get data and will clear the message when we can.
13. Change CHECK CGM message to CHECK RIG to clarify to the user that they need to check the entire rig, not just the CGM.
14. Ability to set custom and multiple animation messages at different BG levels in the code.

1. Extended timeout for DATA OFFLINE condition
2. Extended timeout for RSTRT WCH/PH condition
3. Added vibe for DATA OFFLINE condition
4. Don't wipeout screen for DATA OFFLINE condition

1. Fix for watch freezing
2. Fix for ERR codes
3. Fix for HTML timeouts
4. New global variable to turn off all vibrations (HardCode)
5. New slot2 loads have new config files
Holiday Motivation Version

1. Configurable settings for vibrations - high bg, low bg, snooze times, vibration levels, vibration patterns
2. Configurable setting for 12 hour or 24 hour time
3. App crash fixes, having to do with pebble string buffers
4. App crash fixes, having to do with pebble SDK 2.8
5. Change MMOL LO threshold setting so will show LO
6. Change menuicon to cloud to avoid app crash on pebble SDK 2.8

1. New Vibration Patterns - 3 Levels. Shake and Wake for lows. Long and Strong for highs and special values. Buzzy Bee for everything else.
2. RSTRT WCH/PH - Watch will show RSTRT WCH/PH for any offline, stale data, or watch freezing condition that can not be fixed by software, prompting user to first try restarting watch to fix, then restarting phone to clear up condition.
2. NO ENDPOINT Msg - Watch will show NO ENDPOINT when nothing found in endpoint field in SETTINGS file, prompting user to open SETTINGS on pebble app and enter or re-enter pebble endpoint information.
3. Low Battery Alerts - Watch will now vibrate once and highlight percentage when uploader battery gets to 20% or lower. Especially good for people with uploaders on wireless chargers.
4. APP CRASH fixes - Implemented multiple fixes for APP CRASH conditions.
Fix for iPhone refresh

R5.0 Updates
1. Loads faster
2. New vibration pattern
3. Post HI and LO for high and low BG, like receiver
4. Post ERR for any invalid input to watch (check pebble endpoint msg)
5. Less CHECK PHONE and CHECK CGM msgs (timeouts 5 minutes longer)

data.description:
Do you like astronomy or simply want an unusual watchface? Use Ecliptic - it displays positions of the Sun, the Moon, stars and five brightest planets of the solar system that are visible with the naked eye. You can change the background color, enable hourly vibrations and lost connection notification in settings. The Sun is always drawn on top of the ecliptic circle. To the left of the Sun you see planets that are currently visible in the evening after the sunset. To the right there are planets you can see in the morning before the sunrise. Planets in the bottom part of the screen are visible all night long. 

Legend:
☉ - Sun
☿ - Mercury
♀ - Venus
♂ - Mars
♃ - Jupiter
♄ - Saturn

The Moon glyph changes according to the current phase. Planetary data isn't loaded from the Internet. Orbital elements of each displayed celestial body are built-in and all calculations are performed by the Pebble processor. GPS data isn't required because the Ecliptic code operates with ecliptic coordinates that do not depend on your current location (unless you are an astronaut in space far away from Earth). Background stars and zodiacal constellations lines are displayed. Stars up to 4.5 magnitude are visible, with respect to their actual brightness and color.

data.description:
Pebble has a flexilbe bitmap display. Older (digital) watches have 7-segment displays; still older (mechanical) watches have physical hands.

Many Pebble watchfaces emulate these older technologies. Clockitron combines all three. It's a bitmap display that pretends to be a matrix of 7-segment digits that pretend to show physical hands.
